intro: Schizoglossum periglossoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its botanical features include a basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem that bears a single head of ray flowers. Schizoglossum periglossoides is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with low precipitation.
